name: rocketing
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
present participle of
rocket
to rise extremely quickly or make extremely quick progress towards success: House prices in the north are rocketing (up). Their team rocketed to the top of the League. Sharon Stone rocketed to fame in the film "Basic Instinct".
Thesaurus: synonyms, antonyms, and examples
to increaseincreaseWe need to increase production to meet demand.growThe number of people living alone grows each year.risePrices rose by 10 per cent.go upHouse prices keep going up.escalateCrime in the city has escalated in recent weeks.
